div.l: He getered him a meyne of his sort
And thenne thei sette steuen for to mete
To pleye at the dys in such a strete
For in the Citee was non apprentys
That feyrer couthe caste a peyre of dys
Then Perkyn couthe ⁊and therto he was fre
Of his dispence in place of pryuete
That fonde his maister in his chaffare
For ofte he fond his boxe al bare
For siker a prentyse a reuelour͗e
That haunteth dys ryot ⁊and paramour͗e
His maister shall hit in his shop a by
Thaugh he haue no part of the mynstrelsy
For as hit is seyd in the byble
Thefte ⁊and ryot ben conuertyble
Also he con pleye on guterne ⁊and sawtrye
And therto he bereth a lecherows eye
Reuell ⁊and trouthe as in a lowe degre
Thei ben ful wroth al day as men may se
¶ This Ioly apprentys wᵗith his maister a bod
Till he were mygh out of his prentyshod
Thaugh he were snybbed erly ⁊and late
And som tyme lad wᵗith reuell to Newegate
But at the laste his maister him bi thought
Vpon a day when he his paper sought
Of a ꝓprouerbe that seith this same word
Wel better is roten appull out of hord
Then that he roten al the remenaunt
¶ So fareth hit bi a ryotes seruaunt
Hit is wel lasse harm to let him passe
Then he shende all the ʆseruantes of a place
Ther fore he yaf him on acquytaıı̄unce
